text: Carlos Quiñones Velázquez [″Carlín″] (March 22, 1948 – March 16, 2000) was a relief pitcher in Major League Baseball. Listed at 5' 11", 180 lb., he batted and threw right handed.Baseball Reference – Major league profile Born in Loiza, Puerto Rico, Velázquez joined the Milwaukee Brewers of the American League during the 1973 midseason. He posted a 2–2 record and saved two games in his brief majors stint. He also pitched eight Minor league seasons from 1969 through 1976, going 46–48 with a 2.69 earned run average in 301 appearances.Baseball Reference – Minor league career Velázquez died in his hometown of Loiza at the age of 51. ==See also== * List of Major League Baseball players from Puerto Rico ==Sources== Category:1948 births Category:2000 deaths Category:People from Loíza, Puerto Rico Category:Major League Baseball pitchers Category:Major League Baseball players from Puerto Rico Category:Milwaukee Brewers players Category:Clinton Pilots players Category:Danville Warriors players Category:Evansville Triplets players Category:Newark Co-Pilots players Category:Oklahoma City 89ers players Category:Puerto Rico Boricuas players Category:Sacramento Solons players Category:Spokane Indians players
title: Carlos Velázquez (baseball)
